marketNews.title: China Politburo Policy Shift Spurs Surge in Stocks, Bonds
marketNews.content: The decision-making body of the Chinese Communist Party, the Politburo, stated that China will adopt a monetary policy that is "quite loose" in 2025, a stance last taken in 2010 to support recovery from the global financial crisis. The Politburo also mentioned that the Chinese government will stabilize the stock and property markets, and must strongly boost consumption and expand domestic demand "in all directions." Morgan Stanley's team of economists stated that the Politburo's statement provides the most aggressive stimulus tone in the last decade, although implementation remains uncertain.

marketNews.title: Government Plans to Continue VAT and Luxury Tax Subsidies
marketNews.content: The Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Susiwijono Moegiarso, stated that the government plans to continue the Value Added Tax (VAT) borne by the government (DTP) for property and the Luxury Goods Sales Tax (PPnBM) DTP for electric vehicles. Susiwijono mentioned that the regulations for both tax subsidies are currently being prepared by the Ministry of Finance and are expected to be released by the end of 2024. The Deputy Chairman of the Indonesian Employers Association, Sanny Iskandar, welcomed the government's plan. However, Sanny suggested that the government needs to provide a longer subsidy duration to ensure maximum impact.

marketNews.title: Djarum Group Acquires 85% Stake in Bakmi GM Operator
marketNews.content: DealStreetAsia reported that the Djarum group has acquired an 85% stake in PT Griya Miesejati, the operator of Bakmi GM, with a transaction value ranging from 2-2.4 trillion Rupiah. The Corporate Communication Manager of the Djarum group, Budi Darmawan, stated that he did not deny the news, although he was reluctant to comment further.

marketNews.title: Government Confirms No Imports for Key Commodities in 2025
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, stated that the government will not import rice, consumption corn and feed corn, consumption salt, and consumption sugar in 2025. Zulkifli claimed that national rice stocks, from traders to the public level, are at a safe level, amounting to over 8 million tons.

tickerNews.title: OCBC & CIMB Reportedly Interested in Acquiring PNBN
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation Ltd. (OCBC Singapore) and CIMB Group Holdings Bhd. (CIMB Malaysia) are competing to acquire a controlling stake in Bank Pan Indonesia (PNBN). Reuters sources mentioned that OCBC Singapore and CIMB Malaysia have submitted non-binding offers for the shares being offered by ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. and the Gunawan family. The offers are reportedly due this month. In addition to OCBC Singapore and CIMB Malaysia, Reuters sources mentioned that Maybank Group Malaysia, Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), and Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp (SMBC) are also interested in buying PNBN. PNBN has not commented on this issue, while OCBC Singapore, CIMB Malaysia, Maybank Malaysia, MUFG, and SMBC declined to comment. Previously, Bloomberg and Reuters reported that the Gunawan family and ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. were considering selling their stake in PNBN. Together they own a total of 85.74% of PNBN shares, with the controlling Gunawan family holding 46.52% and ANZ holding 39.22%. Their combined shares were valued at approximately 39 trillion Rupiah based on Tuesday's (10/12) closing price. Key Takeaway: If this acquisition materializes, both OCBC Singapore and CIMB Malaysia as potential buyers could potentially consolidate PNBN into their respective existing business units - Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) if purchased by CIMB Malaysia, or Bank OCBC NISP (NISP) if purchased by OCBC Singapore. This is because Indonesian banking regulations require a single presence policy, where each controlling shareholder can only own one bank or several banks through a consolidation scheme. The bank consolidation scheme can take the form of a merger, amalgamation, integration, or the establishment of a Joint Business Group (KUB). On this day, the PNBN stock price closed up +5.8% at 2,010 Rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Buys 68 Million SCMA Shares Again
tickerNews.content: Surya Citra Media's controller, Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK), bought 68 million SCMA shares at a price of 144 Rupiah per share on December 6-9, 2024. The total transaction value reached 9.8 billion Rupiah. Following this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 61.09% to 61.18%. Previously, EMTK bought 87 million (0.12%) SCMA shares at a price of 137 Rupiah per share on December 4-5, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu Increases Indirect Ownership in BREN
tickerNews.content: The indirect controller of Barito Renewables Energy, Prajogo Pangestu, bought 1.1 million BREN shares at an average price of 7,470 Rupiah per share on December 5, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 8.2 billion Rupiah. Following this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu's ownership in BREN increased from 0.09701% to 0.09783%.

tickerNews.title: Bank Mandiri Targets Credit Growth Above Industry in 2025
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri's Head of Investor Relations, Laurensius Teiseran, stated that the bank targets to maintain credit growth above the industry average in 2025, although he did not provide further details. Bank Indonesia itself targets credit growth in 2025 to be around +11-13% YoY. Laurensius mentioned that the downward trend in interest rates can provide a positive sentiment towards credit demand.

tickerNews.title: UNVR Directors Resign, New Director Nominees Proposed
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia announced that 3 of the company's directors - namely Vivek Agarwal, Ainul Yaqin, and Hernie Raharja - have submitted plans to resign from their positions. The main shareholders of UNVR also plan to propose Neeraj Lal, Vandana Suri, and Alejandro Meinardo Santos Concha as the new directors of the company. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on January 14, 2025.

tickerNews.title: EXCL and FREN Merger Details Nearing Completion, Announcement Expected This Week
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the controllers of XL Axiata (EXCL) and Smartfren Telecom (FREN) are close to reaching a merger agreement for the two telecommunication operators, with transaction details likely to be announced this week. Bloomberg sources mentioned that talks between the two parties are still ongoing and the announcement timing may still be delayed.

tickerNews.title: Manoj Dhamoo Punjabi Sells Major Stake in FILM for Strategic Investor Opportunity
tickerNews.content: The indirect controller and President Director of MD Entertainment, Manoj Dhamoo Punjabi, sold approximately 485 million FILM shares at an average price of 2,600 Rupiah per share on December 3, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.3 trillion Rupiah and was intended to provide opportunities for strategic investors. Following this transaction, Manoj Dhamoo Punjabi's ownership in FILM decreased from 16.82% to 11.92%.

tickerNews.title: INDY Acquires 100% Stake in PT Pahala Globalindo Energi for Diversification
tickerNews.content: Indika Energy, through its subsidiaries PT Interport Mandiri Utama and PT Interport Mandiri Abadi, has signed an agreement to acquire 100% of the shares of PT Pahala Globalindo Energi worth 7.2 billion Rupiah. PT Pahala Globalindo Energi is engaged in the business of buying and selling fuel. INDY stated that this transaction is aimed at expanding the company's business in line with its diversification strategy.

tickerNews.title: TCPI Sells Two Vessels for Fleet Renewal
tickerNews.content: Transcoal Pacific announced the sale of 1 motor vessel and 1 barge vessel worth 24 billion Rupiah to a non-affiliated party. This transaction is intended for the renewal of the company's vessel fleet.

tickerNews.title: TOTL Achieves New Contract Value Exceeding 2024 Target, Remains Cautious on 2025 Outlook
tickerNews.content: Total Bangun Persada's Corporate Secretary, Anggie S. Sidharta, stated that the company has recorded a new contract value of 4.67 trillion Rupiah during 11M24, exceeding (104%) of the 2024 target of 4.5 trillion Rupiah. Anggie explained that TOTL will remain vigilant and prudent in maintaining positive cash flow in 2025, especially due to issues that need attention such as geopolitical tensions and price inflation. Anggie mentioned that the increase in Value Added Tax (VAT) to 12% in 2025 is also a concern for TOTL in maintaining company performance, considering that the VAT increase will affect material price fluctuations.

tickerNews.title: HUMI Acquires Tugboat and Barge Set Funded by Debt and Internal Cash
tickerNews.content: Humpuss Maritim Internasional (HUMI) through its subsidiary, PT Humpuss Transportasi Curah, announced the purchase of 1 set of tugboats and barges worth 24 billion Rupiah from a non-affiliated party. The transaction is financed by 70% from bank debt and 30% from internal funds. This transaction is intended to develop the company's subsidiary.

tickerNews.title: LPCK Plans Rights Issue Up to 2.97 Billion Shares to Fund Subsidiary and Working Capital
tickerNews.content: Lippo Cikarang (LPCK) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to approximately 2.97 billion new shares with an exercise price of 500 Rupiah per share, resulting in a dilution effect of up to 52.61%. The maximum potential funds raised reached approximately 1.5 trillion Rupiah, which is intended for capital injection into its subsidiary, PT Mahkota Sentosa Utama, as well as company working capital. The cum-rights date in the regular and negotiation market is February 4, 2025, with the indicative rights trading period being February 10-14, 2025.

tickerNews.title: KKGI Revises Interim Share Dividend Ratio Due to Reduced Treasury Stock Distribution
tickerNews.content: Resource Alam Indonesia (KKGI) announced a revision of the interim share dividend ratio from 190:3 to 10,000:53, corresponding to a reduction in the treasury shares to be distributed from 61.2 billion Rupiah to 15.3 billion Rupiah. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market remains December 30, 2024, with distribution on January 17, 2025. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on December 18, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Amir Sunarko Increases Direct Ownership in SULI via Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: The indirect controller and President Director of SLJ Global (SULI), Amir Sunarko, bought approximately 105.3 million SULI shares at an average price of 154 Rupiah per share on December 5, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 16.2 billion Rupiah. Following this transaction, Amir Sunarko's direct ownership in SULI increased from 3.84% to 5.61%.
